meanings.definition: A strong alcoholic drink made from apples.
meanings.sent1: At the party, they passed around a bottle of applejack.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed sipping on applejack while sitting by the fireplace.
meanings.sent3: The applejack was so potent, it made Granny Smith do a little dance.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of applejack filled the room, warming everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The golden color of applejack shimmered in the dim light, enticing all to try a sip.

meanings.definition: To distill cider to make applejack.
meanings.sent1: They decided to applejack the fresh cider to create a special batch.
meanings.sent2: The old farmer taught his grandson how to applejack the apples for a stronger drink.
meanings.sent3: When the kids tried to applejack the juice, they ended up with a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The moonshiner knew just the right time to applejack the cider for the best flavor.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of apples filled the air as they worked to applejack the cider, anticipating the final product.
